data.title: Christ, Our Light! Catholic Church
data.meta_description: Christ, Our Light! Catholic Church - And More: page
data.text:
Ongoing and Upcoming Events

During the school year:

Grades 1 thru 4: Mondays, 5 - 6:15 PM; Grades 5 thru 8: Mondays, 6:30 - 8 PM.

Sunday: Preschool/Kinder (ages 3 - 6) at 9:30 and 11 AM Masses; Liturgy of the Word for Children (LWC) for grades K-6 takes place during the 9:30 and 11 AM Masses during the school year.

Contact: Jo Mateus at josylin.mateus@coltroy.org; 248.649.5510, ext. 107

_______________

SPECIAL NEEDS ALL BELONG FAITH ENRICHMENT COMMUNITY

The "All Belong" ministry has a website with valuable resources, information and classes -- as well as a video we helped create -- at allbelongaod.org. Also, please see the recent article about us at Detroit Catholic: click here.

____________________

C.O.L.T.: CHRIST, OUR LIGHT! TEENS HIGH SCHOOL YOUTH MINISTRY

C.O.L.T. (Christ, Our Light! Teens) is where teens come to live out their faith with others their age. Teens participate in social activities, service projects and faith building. We host movie nights, field trips, dances, and lots of fun and food to eat when we are together. FRIENDS are WELCOME! Upcoming event: Cedar Point trip on Saturday, August 10. Contact: Alexis Shayota at: alexis.shayota@coltroy.org

_____________________

RCIA

For all adults who are interested in learning more about the Catholic faith, are preparing to receive the Sacraments of Baptism or Confirmation, or are interested in becoming Catholic. Classes are on Wednesdays, 7 - 8 PM and will begin in the fall. All are welcome; no registration required.

_____________________

CHRISTIAN SERVICE

Interested in working with - or becoming - one of our Christian Service leaders? Our outreach areas include: holiday giving, funeral luncheon service, helping the homebound, health education, and many more. All are welcome to join us at our meetings, normally held on the second Tuesday of the month (not held during summer months).Please contact Elaine Cervera at 248.649.5510, ext. 105, or email her at elaine.cervera@coltroy.org, if you need further information.

_____________________

LUNCH BUNCH

All adults (from any parish) are welcome! Please bring your own lunch. Next meeting date will be announced soon. Thanks to all who attended in March!

__________________________

BIBLE AND BAGELS

Bible & Bagels, when in session, is on Wednesdays from 10 AM-Noon. Next session to be announced. No registration necessary. All adults are welcome, even if you cannot attend every session. Contact person: JoAnn Bonahoom at joann.bonahoom@coltroy.org.

_____________________

HELPING THE HOMEBOUND

We need Eucharist Ministers for the homebound! If you would like to bring the Eucharist to the homebound, or if you are aware of a homebound parishioner who would like to receive the Eucharist, please contact Elaine Cervera at elaine.cervera@coltroy.org or 248.649.5510, ext. 105.

__________________________

ONGOING OUTREACHES

SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL (SVdP)

Thanks to all who continue to support us through the year by leaving cash and checks in our "Poor Box," located in the church on the north wall, between the doors to the vestibule and the baptismal font.

If you know of a family experiencing a hardship, please direct them to call the church office and leave a message on our SVdP line. A Vincentian will call within 24 hours. We can help with evictions, food and clothing needs, and utility shut-offs for parishioners and anyone living within our parish boundaries. People who live outside our parish boundaries will be referred to the SVdP conference that serves their area.

We are looking for new members! If you are interested in joining us in our mission, please feel welcome to attend one of our meetings. We meet monthly on the fourth Thursday of the month at 7 pm. All are welcome! We would love new members! Please call the SVdP line if you have questions (248.649.5510, ext. 112).

_____________________

A VISION FOR CLEAN WATER

A Vision For Clean Water at https://avisionforcleanwater.org also know as AVFCW, is a non-profit (501c3) with the goal of teaching and training others how to design, implement, and sustain clean water and sanitation projects in countries around the world.

______________________

KNIGHTS OF COLUMBUS 4188 CLAWSON

Joining the Knights will enrich your life, even if you have only ten hours a year to help with the Tootsie Roll drive, the Lenten Fish Fry, the bottle-and-can drives, or Bingo. Contact Terry Clayton at: 248.795.9698 or tclayton7984@yahoo.com. Feel free to follow the Clawson Knights on Facebook by searching: “Clawson Knights of Columbus 4188” and then click join!

____________________

SAINT DOMINIC OUTREACH

Serving the needs of eligible individuals and families in the Detroit community, Saint Dominic Outreach continues to supply food pantry groceries (and much more). Donations may be made on their website:https://www.stdominicoutreach.org/donate.html

Also grateful for the food items brought to our large blue bin at our Coolidge church entrance: pull-tab canned salmon, ham, chicken, ravioli, spaghetti; stovetop, boxed-rice and macaroni-and-cheese meals; packets of tuna, etc. With any questions, please feel free to call the center at 313.831.6070.

_____________________

THANK YOU to all who donated blood and helped at the June blood drive! The Red Cross desperately needs pints of blood! To donate for the next blood drive on Monday, October 21, at Our Shepherd Lutheran Church at 2225 East 14 Mile Road in Birmingham, please click here to register, call Pat Dobosenski at 248.422.4729, or scan this qr code:

If you would like to sign up to be considered as a bone marrow donor and are between the ages of 18 - 44, please visit www.bethematch.

_______________________

RIGHT TO LIFE - LIFESPAN

Many thanks to all who so generously help support this special outreach! RIGHT-TO-LIFE/LIFESPAN: milifespan.org

_______________________

STRANGERS NO LONGER

Tuesday, July 16, 7 PM: Dear Friends,I’ve had the opportunity to hear Dylan Corbett from El Paso, Texas, where he is the executive director of the Hope Border Institute. Dylan brings knowledge and background on issues of international and human development globally. He will discuss the current immigrant situation at our U.S. southern border. If you are interested, you are welcome to join us for this Zoom program, Tuesday evening at 7pm. Simply click the link below to register.

Click here

Strangers No Longer (501c3) is a network of congregations in our Archdidiocese. Circles of Support in more than 20 parishes provide assistance to immigrants in the Michigan area and advocate for comprehensive and humane immigration policies.

Parish Circle Leader: Kay Sulfaro, SNL board member; kcsulfaro@gmail.com

_____________________

LADIES OF CHARITY:

An all-volunteer organization (founded by Saint Vincent de Paul in the 17th century!) aiding over 5,000 area families each year. We have a Clothes Closet and Food Pantry (in a building behind Saint Hugo of the Hills on Opdyke Road in Bloomfield Hills) receiving donations that we provide to agencies helping those in need, especially in emergency situations. Volunteers needed: men and women are welcome!

For questions or to volunteer, visit theladiesofcharity.org

If you change your name, address, phone number, or registration status, please remember to notify the Parish Office - 248.649.5510. Thank you!
